image.altText: Glenorchy City Council building

props.synopsis: Talk of councils merging is a long-running topic in Tasmania — and with Hobart councillors expressing an openness to merging with nearby Glenorchy, the issue is live again.

title.children: Council merger floated again, but some wary of 'diabolical' public polling

image.altText: A person sits in a cell, as seen through a heavy door with a barred viewing window in it.

props.synopsis: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's only youth detention centre, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months — time he does not have.

title.children: Terminally ill man in race against time to access records of child imprisonment

image.altText: Southern elephant seal pup

props.synopsis: The federal government says testing confirms the presence of avian influenza in samples collected from southern elephant seals on Heard Island — a sub-Antarctic Australian external territory.

title.children: Bird flu confirmed in elephant seal population at Heard Island

image.altText: Australian currency including $50 and $100 banknotes.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's state-owned electricity distributor says a wave of executives receiving six-figure termination payments will, in the end, save the utility money in the long run.

title.children: Tasmanian executive's $712k payout the last of the 'legacy entitlements'

image.altText: Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Carlo Di Falco

props.synopsis: Key figures in Tasmania's Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Party have quit following new MP Carlo Di Falco's backflip on the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: Hobart stadium backflip sparks row in Shooters, Fishers, Farmers party

props.synopsis: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

title.children: Tasmanian mental health patients facing some of the longest ED wait times

image.altText: a picture of a muddy waterfront on a sunny blue day

props.synopsis: Hobart Lord Mayor Anna Reynolds says water testing results are "not how people might perceive it to be".

title.children: Would you swim at Cornelian Bay? It could soon be an option

image.altText: Auctioneer gestures to the crowd in front of a house he is selling. The sky is blue and a large crowd gather to watch

props.synopsis: Amid global warnings of impending financial doom, APRA and the Reserve Bank are far more concerned about a home-grown bubble, one that's been taking in oxygen for almost three decades.

title.children: Forget Wall Street, bitcoin and AI. Here's a real Aussie bubble

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a glass window

props.synopsis: Superannuation giant Cbus will pay a $23.5 million fine after admitting it breached the law over major delays in its handling of insurance claims.

title.children: 'Promise to do better': Super giant Cbus ordered to pay $23.5m fine

image.altText: Bendigo Bank signage on a building.

props.synopsis: Australian shares gained ground on Tuesday, despite Bendigo and Adelaide Bank shares plunging more than 7 per cent after "deficiencies" in anti-money laundering systems were uncovered.

title.children: Bendigo Bank shares dive on money laundering worries, ASX gains — as it happened

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of Parliament House, surrounded by other men.

props.synopsis: David Adeang said in an interview conducted in Nauruan that members of the NZYQ cohort could be returned to their home countries and suggested Australia should remain partially responsible for finding a longer-term solution for the group.

title.children: Nauru president says NZYQ cohort could go home in interview about secretive deal

image.altText: An aerial view of the city of Jakarta, with buildings and houses bisected by roads.

props.synopsis: For decades Tokyo held the title of the most populous city on the planet. Yet the Indonesian and Bangladeshi capitals have overtaken the Japanese megacity.

title.children: Jakarta is now the world's largest city dwarfing Australia's entire population

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie with a man and three young children, whose faces have been blurred.

props.synopsis: The family's alternative lifestyle came under scrutiny after the British-Australian couple and their three children were hospitalised last year with mushroom poisoning.

title.children: Children removed from Australian-British couple living off-grid in Italian forest

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of Australian and Solomon Islands flags

props.synopsis: Australia and Solomon Islands have made little progress on a $190 million package to expand the Pacific nation’s police force, almost a full year after the high-profile initiative was announced.

title.children: Australia's $190m policing deal with Solomon Islands stalls over 'language'

image.altText: About six Myanmar youths sitting at desks in a concrete room.

props.synopsis: The US government is ending the temporary legal status of thousands of Myanmar nationals arguing they can safely return to the war-torn South-East Asian country.

title.children: US says Myanmar 'safe', terminates nationals' protection status

image.altText: Buildings in ruins after being hit by a cyclone

props.synopsis: A luxury wilderness resort only accessible by sea and air has been significantly damaged in a direct hit from Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina, which made landfall in an extremely remote part of WA.

title.children: Remote luxury resort in WA suffers severe damage after Cyclone Fina’s direct hit

image.altText: Elon Musk stands wearing a dark suit, in front of vertical black and white striped lights.

props.synopsis: Social media platform X launched a new location tool globally over the weekend to "verify authenticity" of profiles, but some experts says the tool has breached user trust and increased misinformation on the platform.

title.children: New location tool on Musk's X might breach user trust

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands convicted child murderer Bevan Spencer von Einem has been taken to the Yatala infirmary in Adelaide where he only has a short time to live.

title.children: Notorious child killer on brink of death in jail

image.altText: Close-up of yellow crime scene tape with out-of-focus street scene

props.synopsis: In an era of grim news and uncertainty, audiences are consistently drawn to murder mysteries. But what's behind that enduring fascination for the genre?

title.children: From cosy crime shows to grisly mysteries, here's why we can't look away

image.altText: Fierce winds brought down trees, destroying a pergola at one property in the coastal suburb of Margate.

props.synopsis: About 90,000 Queenslanders are still without power after giant hailstones, destructive winds and intense lightning lashed parts of the state, with more extreme weather on the way.

title.children: Roofs 'peeled off' houses, schools closed as 'cyclonic' storms lash Queensland

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man engaged in "deceptive" conduct when he raped a woman during a house party and tried to cover it up, prosecutors say.

title.children: Melbourne man faked evidence to cover up house party rape, court told

image.altText: An aerial shot showing six people in high viz uniform stand near a fire and rescue red tent on a ground.

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old allegedly fatally stabbed a 17-year-old boy on Monday a reserve in Rouse Hill in an "unprovoked attack".

title.children: 15yo accused of murder told police 'I just stabbed another boy', court hears

image.altText: A close up of a young man's face, he is wearing a dark grey shirt and has dark hair.

props.synopsis: The Central Coast Council will consider safety improvements at a popular NSW beach as loved ones pay tribute to 18-year-old Riahne Louie Vasquez, who drowned while swimming with friends.

title.children: Call for changes to deadly beach with 'daily' rips after 18yo drowns

image.altText: Golfer Cameron Smith in a stadium, with a pitching wedge across this shoulders.

props.synopsis: Cameron Smith admits he has felt every poor shot and poor round more than ever this season, but he will not reinvent himself to arrest the slide.

title.children: Two years without a win, Smith shifts to cruise control

image.altText: AFL draftee for the West Coast Eagles, Josh Lindsay, posing with a football and smiling

props.synopsis: West Coast draftee Josh Lindsay has opened up about the devastation of losing his mentor Troy Selwood, saying the former Brisbane tagger played a vital role in helping him get on an AFL list.

title.children: Eagles draftee Lindsay wants to carry on Selwood legacy

image.altText: A close up photo shows the face of Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: China's escalating confrontation with Japan is colliding directly with its attempt to join one of the world's most demanding trade agreements.

title.children: China's CPTPP bid runs into an old problem — Japan

image.altText: Tight headshots of Letitia James and James Comey.

props.synopsis: Former FBI director James Comey and New York Attorney-General Letitia James had been charged shortly after Donald Trump used social media to instruct his attorney-general to take action against them.

title.children: US court throws out criminal cases against two of Trump's critics

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing black, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy warns Ukraine's borders 'cannot be changed by force'

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

title.children: Taiwan's 'return to China' key to international order, Xi tells Trump

image.altText: Colourful stalls of different crypto companies with many punters asking questions.

props.synopsis: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

title.children: 'Contagion' fears surface as bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets

image.altText: Kids with blurred faces on the roof of a building.

props.synopsis: WA's corrective services minister says three of the youths involved in last night's disturbance at Perth's juvenile detention centre have been moved to the notorious Unit 18, as he continued to take a hardline stance on youth detention.

title.children: Teens involved in youth detention disturbance moved to notorious Unit 18

image.altText: an outback pub with a sign walkabout crek hotel a young family stand under the sign, two parents, two kids

props.synopsis: Famous worldwide, the Walkabout Creek Hotel has been sold for an undisclosed sum. The previous owners have retired, passing the reins to a young local family.

title.children: Pub made famous by Crocodile Dundee sells after three years on market

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: Parents and guardians have been asked to "make alternative plans" for their children as Queensland teachers walk off the job after rejecting pay offer.

title.children: 'Thank the premier': Teachers strike across Qld for second time this year

image.altText: Idrissa Gueye of Everton clashes with teammate Michael Keane during a Premier League match.

props.synopsis: Idrissa Gueye is involved in a heated moment with Michael Keane during Everton's Premier League match against Manchester United.

title.children: Everton player sent off for slapping teammate during Premier League match

image.altText: A woman in a bright green jump and multi coloured hat smiling and wearing a baby carrier

props.synopsis: New mum Hannah Gheller says social media became a “shame-inducing tool” during the early postpartum weeks.

title.children: Experts recommend new mums stay offline for six weeks after their baby is born
